name: Hotel Le Littre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here over Christmas 2007 for four days. We will definitely stay again, and we are recommending to this hotel to friends & family.
reviews.title: Fine Stay - The reviews are for real!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Large by Paris standards, we asked for an upgrade to the St. Germaine room, and they did so for no charge, as they had vacancies over the holiday. Well laid out floor plan with dual closets and sitting area. Bathroom was huge and extremely well appointed.
reviews.title: We don't want you to know how GREAT the Littre is...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location: One block North of Montparnasse. Basically up the street and around the corner to the Metro entrance. Very convenient. Small tabac stop on same street sells Metro 10 pac tickets. VERY QUIET LOCATION, no noise at night despite being very close to Montparnasse.
reviews.title: Worth every penny (euro)

likes.disliked: — temperature of tea and coffee - too cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff: Extremely pleasant, they do try hard to please! They were very willing to help with anything we needed.
reviews.title: Favourite Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food: Breakfast was included in our package, it was just fine, and they did very well on the coffee. Breakfast meat, scrambled eggs, cheese, breads, fruit, yogurt, cereals, etc. They were happy to prepare a tray of coffee/tea/hot chocolate to take back up to the room. Room service options are limited, but they were very fast with the service and the food was fine. Cute bar connected to the lobby, was mostly empty during our stay and the staff would let us take a drink to our room or offer to deliver drinks to our room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — price of breakfast and minibar price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very charming and comfortable . It was a great location for shopping and restaurants but a little far to the main attractions. It was hard to get a cab off the street but the hotel seemed to be the best bet to help out. The staff was very friendly and helpful and took the time to help you find your way. The rooms were very clean, especially the bathroom. The only complaint I have was that there were only 3 english channels on TV so when it was time to relax we had to either watch BBC or CNN and BBCPrime. Otherwise, breakfast was awesome and I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I just arrived from Paris, where I spent 10 days on Hotel Le Littre.
reviews.title: great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great, near to Montparnasse Metro with connection to different lines. Breakfast was very good. I would like to make a special thanks to Juliana, a brazilian girl from hotel staff.
reviews.title: Le Littre shines

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Fatima from Sao Paulo, Brazil
reviews.title: HO hum

likes.disliked: — crampedness of the room and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Le Littre hotel from the 9th to 13th September 2008.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paris is very expensive and rooms are usually small from a canadian point of view. Taking these facts as granted, I would return to the Littré any time.
reviews.title: Excellent 4 star in Paris

likes.disliked: — It would be nice to be forewarned when the management decides to change locks on doors.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They have many employees at the reception but two are clearly outstanding (François and Nicolas) and they are working often. Others are not always as helpful.
reviews.title: Eight Friends
enjoyed my stay
reviews.text: The room is relatively large for Paris. The bathroom is nice, clean and everything works.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is good and they have eggs, sausages, a variety of cereals and, of course, croissants, chocolatines etc.
reviews.title: Tired, old place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though we were next to an elevator, we did not hear much noise. (I am very sensitive to the noise.)
reviews.title: Great little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was beyond our expectations. Nicely located on the Left Bank and a short walk to two Metro lines, the staff was extraordinarily friendly (English speakers all) and helpful. Our room was incredible, large and with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The included breakfast was far above most continental breakfasts - it was a full breakfast including fresh OJ!
reviews.title: Way Above Expectations...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint (and this goes for most Euro hotels) is that the smell of smoke comes thru the ventilation system slightly. This might be solved next year when France gets tougher on smoking laws, but if you are super-sensitive there can be a hint of that smell in your non-smoking room.
reviews.title: A nice Surprise

likes.liked: — Clean, friendly staff, good breakfasts, small size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I still give the hotel an Excellent rating since its pluses far outweigh the minor minus.
reviews.title: Great Value for Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Date: October 2 thru October 9, 2007
reviews.title: Just be careful, very careful in the bathroom!
Great Hotel for Paris first-timer
reviews.text: Reviewer: RJG

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband booked this hotel for our first trip to Paris as a valentines day surprise therefore i didnt get a chance to do much research on it.
reviews.title: Nice Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: TIP - If you are travelling to Paris via a flight i would recommend using the metro as it is way cheaper than the taxi and only takes about an hour max. Taxi - approx 45 euros whereas Metro - 8 euros per person.
reviews.title: Excellent!

likes.disliked: — Parking not on site, non-street views desperately ordinary and disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were welcomed with friendly receptionist staff. We were also given the option of choosing between 2 rooms - one on the 3rd floor and on the 7th. The one on the 7th floor had been recently refurbished and had a balacony you could sit on and look over to the Eiffel Tower but other than that the views were not the best. We then made our way down to the 3rd floor and although the rooms were not as modern they were more spacious. The new modern room was available but of course at a premium price of 60 euros per night. We werent going to spend a lot of time there so we decided to go for the one originally booked.
reviews.title: Will definately go back

likes.liked: — The lovely Hotel room and delicious breakfast
likes.disliked: — Having to leave and come back home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were comfy, the bathroom clean and there was plenty of space. The breakfast staff were very efficient and helpful but had the same buffet selection each morning.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a great area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were helpful when we were inquiring about some excursions. There was an open tour bus stop 5 minutes down the road which was helpful. For our trip to Disneyland we used the metro and there was a station just down the road too. Location wise you cant go too wrong - bus, metro, shops, food, cinema, bistros are all within walking distance
reviews.title: Friendly well run hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: My brother and I spent 3 nights here on the end of Feb 2008. This was my second time in this hotel in 2 years. The staff was still friendly and very helpful, and the quality of the room was the same as the first time visited. We lived in the room 309- was on the same floor but opposite to the room lived 2 years ago. The view was better this time but the size of the room was a little bit smaller.
reviews.title: The second time in this hotel! Will come back again!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They got more computers(only 1 before) and a new printer at public area this time, and it was helpful that we dont need to wait for it. However, the bad news was now they charge for internet!
reviews.title: A Parisian Treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Will definitely come back again!
reviews.title: Small and Friendly, Lovely Stay

likes.liked: — Location and convenience for the price -- friendly, helpful staff
likes.disliked: — Just the hair dryer, but that's so insignificant given everything else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was lucky enough to be taken to Paris for Valentine's Week by my boyfriend. He booked the hotel as part of a package with Eurostar and I have to say I was very pleased!
reviews.title: An Occasional Aroma Issue

likes.liked: — Staff friendly, Bed very Comfortable, Room Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was incredibly easy to find, just one Metro ride from Gare du Nord which was good as we had our luggage with us, and when we surfaced in Montparnasse it only took a minute to get our bearings and work out where the hotel was. It was down the pretty quiet street Rue Littre which had a large post office on the corner and a couple of little eateries on the way down to the hotel. I think there was also a school at the end of the road although I can't be sure.
reviews.title: loved the littre

likes.liked: — The staff and location and cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: June, 2008
reviews.title: Beautifull little hotel in Montmartre

likes.liked: — large clean rooms and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reviewer: Season travelers, middle age couple from Canada
reviews.title: Super location, friendly staff

likes.disliked: — Our room was a little well worn, time for a coat of paint!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 10 day trip to Paris where we stayed at the Littre Rive Gauche in Montmartre. This hotel had been recommended by our airline and we booked through our agent. To our surprise the room was large (which is unusual in Europe and especially in Paris). It was very well appointed and immaculately clean. The location is within 1.5 block of several main metro lines and in a good district for shopping, eating or just walking around. The staff was very helpfull and breakfast was more than we expected again with very courteous and attentive staff.
reviews.title: Very charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was our 3rd trip to Paris and this was the best budget hotel we have stayed in. I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: What a ride!

likes.disliked: — To be picky and if I had to choose, it would be the American style buffet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great 3 night stay at Littre Hotel. It is in a great position, off the main busy roads, but close enough to walk to the many bars and resturants, plus the metro is very close by. We took the air france transfer bus from the airport, and the drop off point at Montrapasse is only about a 10 min walk. Though I must say this bus does get Very busy, and you cannot always get on the first one that comes, give yourself plent of time to get to the airport.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable - We'd Stay Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel definitely met our needs for our four busy days and nights we were in Paris, but didn't feel like a charming Paris boutique hotel. It was a little worn and lacked charm.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable, but noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, it was clean and the beds were comfortable. The front staff were great and the breakfast was fine.
reviews.title: Recommend this hotel!

likes.disliked: — perhaps small elevator would be difficult for wheelchair access?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The street it was on, Rue de Littre, was not charming either and boy was it noisy.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: Our room was on the second floor and faced the street. Every night there were loud people up at the bar til late into the night.
reviews.title: Great little hotel to stay in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The noise really detracted from our stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic location and great value!

likes.liked: — The hotel itself had fantastic decor and was lovely and cosy.
likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything I didn't like!

description: In the heart of the Left Bank, Le Littre, a four star hotel, combines the fame of Saint Germain des Pres, the effervescence of the Quartier Latin, the bohemia of Montparnasse and the romanticism of the Luxembourg garden.A few steps away from restaurants, the shops of Rue de Rennes, bistros and literary cafes, antique shops and art galleries, the Hotel Le Littre welcomes you in a calm and convivial atmosphere.
